title.narrative: WASH OP 1 - POLICY AND CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By the end of 2020, the government demonstrates increased political commitment and capacity to legislate, plan, budget, coordinate, deliver, monitor and evaluate WASH interventions at scale at national and sub-national levels.

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: Madagascar United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Madagascar (Water Sanitation and Hygiene)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Madagascar: Impact Evaluation of Fiavota Phase 1 Emergency and Recovery Cash Transfer in Madagascar

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2020, the government demonstrates increased political commitment and capacity to legislate, plan, budget, coordinate, deliver, monitor and evaluate WASH interventions at scale at national and sub-national levels.

description.narrative: Led by the ministry in charge of WASH, together with UNICEF and partners' support, a renewed WASH sector coordination mechanism at National and Regional level has been set up. UNICEF has been designated as the lead of the WASH Donor Group with USAID as co-lead. The finalisation of WASH Program Sustainability Check, WASH Bottleneck Analysis Tool report and the ODF road map for Madagascar, were key achievements. In addition, the first validated Open Defecation Free national certification protocol was finalised, and the development of a national water safety plan strategy has started. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Costed Plans (Budget Programme a Objective Regional) per Region
New evidence generated for the sector (Studies and Research)
Sanitation and Water for All biannual Action Plan is developed and implemented
Updated and validated WASH Policy and legislation/code, Integrated Water Resource Management and Wash in Schools including equity & gender, and Climate and Environment resilience strategy

actual.value: 2019:All documents planned are delivered: MadaMadio2025 ODF Protocol WASH sector plan WASH sector policy

title.narrative: Sector Information Management System (SESAME) providing complete information is available, reliable in timely manner

baseline.value: SESAME existing but only partially operational
